exam.source: National Center For University Entrance Examination
exam.subject: SekaishiB(main exam)

exam:
Center-2001--Main-WorldHistoryB
2001 Academic Year Main Examination: World History B
[1]
Throughout world history, various empires have been formed.Read the following texts A-C, which relate to such empires and the regions incorporated into them, and answer the questions (Questions 1-11) below.
(27 points)
Ａ Conceptually, the authority of the (1)Holy Roman Empire was supposed to extend across the whole of the western Christian world, but the realm over which it actually ruled was limited to the region centered on what are today the countries of Germany and Austria.The figure who actually built an empire that ruled the majority of Europe was Napoleon, who gained power amid a popular revolution.However, because nationalism eventually arose in each region, it became impossible for such empires to survive.The (2)German Empire built by Bismarck aimed for the creation of a nation state, while Austria took great pains to maintain a multi-ethnic nation.On the other hand, (3)colonial empires were formed by the Great Powers outside Europe.Germany and Italy lagged behind in this process; (4)the former saw the rise of Hitler, who dreamed of the Third Reich ruling Europe, while in the latter emerged Mussolini, who called for the building of an empire to rule the Mediterranean.
Question 1
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that is correct in regard to the empire referred to in the underlined portion (1).
１
①The heyday of this empire was during the Nerva–Antonine dynasty.
②During the 14th century, this empire waged the Hundred Years' War against France.
③Napoleon revived this empire.
④Emperor Henry IV of this empire came into conflict with the Pope.
Question 2
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that is correct in regard to the underlined portion (2).
２
①Bismarck was defeated by Austria in the Austro-Prussian War and abandoned the incorporation of Austria into a unified Germany.
②Bismarck defeated France in the Franco-Prussian War.
③The German Emperor Wilhelm I came into conflict with Bismarck after his coronation and he caused Bismarck to resign.
④The German Empire formed the Triple Alliance with Austria and France.
Question 3
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that is correct in regard to the underlined portion (3).
３
①France expanded into China and leased Kiautschou Bay.
②Germany deployed a global strategy by means of the so-called "3C policy".
③Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom became Empress of India.
④The Netherlands colonized Liberia in the early 20th century.
Question 4
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that is correct in regard to the underlined portion (4).
４
①Mussolini invaded Ethiopia and annexed it.
②Along with Hitler, Mussolini created the Munich-Rome Axis.
③Hitler annexed Poland's Sudetenland.
④The Vichy regime fled to the UK and opposed Hitler.
ＢThere were many ethnic groups in the extensive Ottoman Empire, but (5)religion constituted the main sense of belonging for the people of the empire and for a long time there were few problems arising from differences between ethnic groups.However, in the 19th century, wars began to break out over independence for ethnic groups and, due in part to intervention of the countries of Europe, the breakup and dismantling of the empire progressed.Thus, the Ottoman Empire was forced to accept the contraction of its territory and it fell after the First World War.(6)More than 20 modern countries were part of the realm of the Ottoman Empire during its heyday, but many problems involving ethnic groups arose from the process of drawing up the borders between them.One example of this is the (7)problem of the Kurds, who were divided by national borders between countries including Turkey and Iraq.
Question 5
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence in which the word with a wavy line below it is correct in regard to the underlined portion (5).
５
①In the same way as in the former Muslim dynasty, until the mid-19th century, non-Muslim adult males in the Ottoman Empire were obliged to pay the jizya, which was a poll tax.
②Among the many Jews banished from France because of the re-conquest and recovery of territory (Reconquista) were some who emigrated to the Ottoman Empire.
③Napoleon III, who led the expedition to Egypt famous for the discovery of the Rosetta Stone, issued a proclamation there, in which he claimed that the French army was a group of Muslims.
④Suleiman the Magnificent, who became governor of Egypt in 1805, with the support of the local people, was an Albanian who was born in what is currently Greek territory.
Question 6
From ①~④ below, choose the one option that is incorrect as the name of a country among those referred to the underlined portion (6).
６
①Cyprus
②Hungary
③Bulgaria
④Czech Republic
Question 7
The sentences below describe the emergence in Turkey of the problem referred to in the underlined portion (7).From ①~④ below, choose the correct combination of treaty names that should be inserted into the gaps marked (A) and (B).
７
The Ottoman Empire, as the vanquished nation, concluded the (A) in 1920 with the Entente Powers; as well as substantially reducing its territory, this agreement stipulated the granting of autonomy to Kurds in Eastern Anatolia.However, in 1923, after the fall of the empire, the (B) concluded with the Entente Powers by the new Turkish government in order to secure independence, did not refer to autonomy for the Kurds.
①(A)-Treaty of Sèvres(B)-Treaty of Lausanne
②(A)-Treaty of Lausanne(B)-Treaty of Sèvres
③(A)-Treaty of Paris(B)-Treaty of Lausanne
④(A)-Treaty of Paris(B)-Treaty of Sèvres
ＣThere are cases in which a single region is brought under the rule of various empires and political forces at different points in history, leading to the formation of a composite culture and society.For example, over the course of history, Taiwan, which was an island of Austronesian-speaking aborigines, experienced incursions by a variety of political forces, including the Netherlands, (8)China, and Japan.Among the place names in Taiwan are some that carry the traces of such rule through to the present day (see map).Originally, the sound of the name "Taiwan" was derived from an aboriginal word, but names such as Taipei and Taichung are Chinese-style place names.Moreover, there is also the example of the (9)Japanese who colonized Taiwan assigning the characters 高雄 (Takao) to signify the local sound of the name "Takow"(currently known as Kaohsiung).Furthermore, after (10)Japan's defeat in the war, quite a few (11)place names were changed by the government of the Republic of China.
Question 8
In regard to the underlined portion (8), from ①~④ below, choose the most appropriate option as the name of the Chinese dynasty that first ruled Taiwan.
８
①Han
②Tang
③Yuan
④Qing
Question 9
In regard to the underlined portion (9), from ①~④ below, choose the correct name of the war that brought about Japan's rule over Taiwan.
９
①The First Sino-Japanese War
②The Russo-Japanese War
③The First World War
④The Second Sino-Japanese War
Question 10
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that is correct in regard to the underlined portion (10).
10
①A representative of China also participated in the Cairo Conference and it was decided to return Taiwan.
②Stalin participated in the Cairo Conference, representing the Soviet Union.
③The Potsdam Declaration demanded the surrender of Japan and Germany.
④Chiang Kai-shek traveled to Taiwan and led the resistance against the Japanese.
Question 11
In regard to the underlined portion (11), the map below shows part of what is currently the city of Taipei; all of the names of the streets (A)-(C) are taken from political ideals that form the cornerstones of the Chinese Nationalist Party (Kuomintang of China).From ①~④ below, choose which of the options corresponds to the name of the street that fits into the gap marked (a).
11
①Minguo (Republic of China)
②Minzhu (democracy)
③Minzhong (the people)
④Minsheng (people's welfare)
[2]
Over the course of history, the interests of states have led to the creation of many treaties and declarations.Read the following texts A-D, which relate to such matters, and answer the questions (Questions 1-10) below.(Some of the historical sources have been rewritten or abridged).
(24 points)
ＡThe text below forms part of a treaty concluded in 1004 between the Khitan State (Liao) and the Song, called the Chanyuan Treaty.
Every year, the Song shall send 200,000 (A) and 100,000 pieces of (B) as a contribution to war funds.The Khitan Emperor shall maintain fraternal relations with the Song Emperor and they shall refer to each other as the northern and southern dynasties.The borders between both countries shall all be as they were originally and both sides shall protect their respective borders, with neither side permitting their people to invade the other.The border fortresses and river channels shall remain as they are; no new construction or excavation shall be carried out.
Question 1
From ①~⑥ below, choose the correct combination of words that should be inserted into the gaps marked (A) and (B).
12
①horses - gold
②horses - silver
③horses - iron
④bolts of silk - gold
⑤bolts of silk - silver
⑥bolts of silk - iron
Question 2
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that is a correct statement in relation to this treaty.
13
①After the conclusion of this treaty, the Song also reached a peace settlement with the Western Xia.
②The Liao emperor at the time this treaty was concluded was Yelü Abaoji (Emperor Taizu of Liao).
③As a result of this treaty, the Liao increased their strength as a nation and expanded their influence to Central Asia, building the Kara-Khitan Khanate.
④Those on the Song side who advocated the conclusion of this treaty were bureaucrats affiliated to conservative elements in the dynasty.
ＢThe following text is an excerpt from a treaty concluded between China and Russia (see the map).
The party of Chinese minister Songgotu and the party of Russian ambassador Golovin met at (1) and stipulated the following.
Article 1 From the Gorbitsa River, which flows into Sahaliyan-ula* from the north, the boundary shall run along the spine of the great stony mountain range where this river has its source to the sea; all of the rivers and streams to the south of this that flow into Sahaliyan-ula shall be under the administration of China, while all of the rivers on the north side of this boundary shall be under the jurisdiction of Russia.
*This means "black river" in the Manchu language and refers to the Amur River (Heilong Jiang).
Question 3
From ①~④ below, choose the correct place name, from which the treaty takes its name, that should be inserted into the gap marked (1) in the text.
14
①Aigun
②Kyakhta
③Nerchinsk
④Beijing
Question 4
From ①~④ below, choose the most appropriate sentence concerning China during the period when this treaty was concluded.
15
①The rebellion called the Revolt of the Three Feudatories was subjugated.
②The Sishu Daquan (Great Compendium of the Four Books) was compiled.
③The Great Wall of China was repaired to prepare for an invasion by Esen taishi.
④Licensed trade took place with Japan.
ＣThe following text is an excerpt from an international treaty concluded in the 1920s, which relates to regional security in Western Europe.
Article 1 The High Contracting Parties collectively and severally guarantee the maintenance of the territorial status quo resulting from the frontiers between Germany and Belgium and between Germany and France, and the inviolability of the said frontiers as fixed by or in pursuance of the Treaty of Peace signed at Versailles on June 28, 1919, and also the observance of the stipulations of Articles 42 and 43* of the said treaty concerning the demilitarised zone.
Article 2 Germany and Belgium, and also Germany and France, mutually undertake that they will in no case attack or invade each other or resort to war against each other.
*In Article 42 of the Treaty of Versailles, Germany was prohibited from fortifying the left bank of the Rhine or anywhere in an area within 50 kilometers of the east of the river, while in Article 43, it was prohibited from stationing German armed forces or conducting military maneuvers within that area.
Question 5
From ①~④ below, choose the correct name of this treaty.
16
①Treaty of Rapallo
②Locarno Pact
③Treaty of Brest-Litovsk
④Treaty of Saint-Germain-en-Laye
Question 6
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence in which the word with a wavy line below it is correct in regard to this treaty.
17
①The French army occupied the Rhineland due to default on payments of reparations.
② Through cooperative diplomacy, Ebert achieved Germany's accession to the League of Nations.
③Briand, who contributed to the conclusion of this treaty, later advocated an anti-war treaty.
④The UK, which participated in this treaty, later discussed the ownership ratio of secondary ships at the Washington Naval Conference.
Question 7
In regard to this treaty, from ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that incorrectly describes German foreign policy in the 1930s.
18
①It withdrew from the League of Nations.
②It incorporated the Saarland.
③It ceded Danzig (Gdansk) to Poland.
④It occupied the Rhineland.
ＤAfter the Second World War, the United States of America adopted a policy of providing economic aid to other countries in order to curb the spread of Communist influence.The following text is an excerpt from the Truman Doctrine, which marked the start of this policy.
I believe that our help should be primarily through (2)economic and financial aid which is essential to economic stability and orderly political processes.I therefore ask the Congress to provide authority for assistance to (C) and (D) in the amount of $400,000,000 for the period ending June 30, 1948.
The Government of the United States has made frequent protests against coercion and intimidation in violation of the Yalta Agreement in (3)Poland, Romania, and Bulgaria.
Question 8
In regard to the underlined portion (2), from ①~④ below, choose the one correct sentence concerning the foreign aid policy implemented by the United States of America in response to world affairs after the Second World War.
19
①It implemented the Marshall Plan.
②It implemented the Dawes Plan.
③It issued the Hoover Moratorium.
④It implemented the Young Plan.
Question 9
From ①~⑤ below, choose the correct combination of country names that should be inserted into the gaps marked (C) and (D).
20
①Yugoslavia - Turkey
②Federal Republic of Germany - Austria
③Greece - Turkey
④Yugoslavia - France
⑤UK - Greece
Question 10
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that is correct in regard to the countries referred to in the underlined portion (3).
21
①Romania was one of the first countries to be born after the First World War.
②The Partitions of Poland resulted in the fall of the Jagiellonian dynasty.
③During the First World War, Bulgaria fought on the German side.
④Bulgaria won the Second Balkan War.
[3]
Read the following texts A-C, which relate to the diverse roles of intellectuals throughout world history, and answer the questions (Questions 1-11) below.
(27 points)
ＡThe picture below shows The Four Sages, which was drawn by a Japanese artist during the Meiji period.The accompanying text states, "The Four Sages are Confucius, Buddha, Socrates, and Kant."This is a historical source that shows which thinkers of any era or civilization the Japanese perceived as the Four Great Sages of the world, at a time when they had begun to re-evaluate Eastern civilization while actively accepting Western civilization, following the Meiji Restoration.
Question 1
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that correctly describes trends in Confucianism starting in the times of figure (a) in the picture.
22
①Qin Shihuangdi, the First Emperor, expelled the legalists and defended Confucianism.
②Dong Zhongshu established xungu xue (exegetic semantics), which emphasizes lexical analysis of the Chinese classics.
③Han Yu and others compiled the Wujing zhengyi (Correct Meaning of the Five Classics), thereby providing a unified interpretation of the Confucian classics.
④Zhu Xi assigned special significance to the Sishu (Four Books) and perfected Neo-Confucianism.
Question 2
From ①~⑥ below, choose the correct combination of statements (i)-(iv) in relation to the intellectual lineage of figure (b) in the picture.
23
(i)Francis Bacon advocated empiricism (inductive reasoning), which seeks to elicit general principles from factual observation.
(ii)Descartes established rationalism (deductive reasoning), which seeks to investigate truth mathematically.
(iii)Spinoza rejected continental rationalism.
(iv)British empiricism began with Hume and was perfected by Locke.
①(i)-(ii)
②(i)-(iii)
③(i)-(iv)
④(ii)-(iii)
⑤(ii)-(iv)
⑥(iii)-(iv)
Question 3
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that incorrectly describes intellectuals in ancient Greece in relation to figure (c) in the picture.
24
①Thales and others advocated natural philosophy and sought to identify the properties of nature.
②The Sophists emerged and claimed the existence of absolute truth.
③Plato advocated the Theory of Forms and the Theory of the State.
④Aristotle codified various academic studies and systematized them.
Question 4
From ①~④ below, choose the correct combination of figures a-d in the picture and descriptions of their respective ideas.
25
(i)He advocated the existence of universal truth and thought of the unity of knowledge and virtue as the way of life for citizens.
(ii)He thought that if a person took the right path, they could free themself from the suffering of birth, age, sickness, death.
(iii)He attached importance to the practice of family morality and considered it to be the foundations for social order.
(iv)He engaged in a fundamental reflection on human cognitive abilities and established critical philosophy.
①a-(ii)b-(i)c-(iv)d-(iii)
②a-(ii)b-(iv)c-(i)d-(iii)
③a-(iii)b-(iv)c-(i)d-(ii)
④a-(iii)b-(i)c-(iv)d-(ii)
ＢAt New Year in 1780, the (1)Qianlong Emperor set out on a tour of inspection to the south and, after enjoying the culture and scenery of the lower reaches of the Yangtze River, in places such as Yangzhou (see map), he spent summer and fall at the Chengde Mountain Resort (see map), to the north of the Great Wall, and it was there that he received congratulations on his 70th birthday from his subjects and various ethnic groups.Having witnessed this celebration, the (2)Joseon intellectual Pak Jiwon described it in his work Yeolha Ilki (Rehe Diaries).
At that time, the wealthy merchants of Yangzhou provided support for intellectuals and artists, and the parks were restored to their full glory to improve the local landscape each time the emperor made a tour of inspection to the south, so this city became a center of (3)learning and culture during the Qing dynasty.Moreover, the Chengde Mountain Resort was an imperial villa that incorporated aspects of Mongolian and Tibetan culture, so it symbolized the Qing dynasty's rule over the (4)inland ethnic groups.Thus, Yangzhou and Chengde played a role in bringing Han intellectuals and nobles from inland areas under the rule of the Qing dynasty.
Question 5
The figure referred to in the underlined portion (1) initiated frequent expeditions outside the borders of the empire.From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that correctly describes the foreign relations of successive Chinese dynasties.
26
①Qin Shihuangdi, the First Emperor attacked the Tibetan Empire and repaired the Great Wall of China.
②Emperor Wu of the Western Han dynasty overthrew Wiman Joseon and established the Lelang Commandery in his place.
③The incident in which a Ming Emperor was held captive by Altan Khan is called the Tumu Crisis.
④Kublai Khan of the Yuan destroyed the Taungoo Dynasty of Burma (Myanmar).
Question 6
In regard to the underlined portion (2), from ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that incorrectly describes the dynasty that ruled the Korean Peninsula at that time.
27
①After the establishment of the dynasty, it designated Kaesong as the new capital.
②It attached importance to the Cheng-Zhu school and designated this as the state-sanctioned approach to learning.
③It instituted the phonetic alphabet called Hunminjeongeum.
④The people of the ruling class in this dynasty were called the yangban.
Question 7
In regard to the underlined portion (3), from ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that correctly describes learning and culture during the Qing period.
28
①The Kunyu Wanguo Quantu (Map of the Myriad Countries of the World) was compiled at the order of the Qianlong Emperor.
②Gu Yanwu criticized kaozheng xue (evidential scholarship).
③The Literary Inquisition took place and anti-Qing sentiment was suppressed.
④Qian Daxin devised the Manchu alphabet.
Question 8
In regard to the underlined portion (4), from ①~④ below, choose the one correct sentence concerning the history of various ethnic groups in inland Asia.
29
①The influence of the Khwarazmian dynasty extended as far as Central Asia, but it was overthrown by Ghazan.
②Je Tsongkhapa reformed Tibetan Buddhism and founded the Gelug school (Yellow Hat Sect).
③The Zunghar Khanate engaged in ongoing opposition to the Qing dynasty, but it weakened and was annexed by Russia.
④The Qing dynasty established the zhong shu sheng (Central Secretariat) to control regions such as Mongolia and Tibet.
Ｃ(5)The 19th century French literary giant Victor Hugo lived a tumultuous life as a politician.Hugo, who was a member of the Chamber of Peers at the time of the July Monarchy, was also elected as a member of the National Constituent Assembly following the French Revolution of 1848 (February Revolution).At the time of the coup d'état of 1851, he organized an opposition committee and called for the defense of the republic, but this ended in failure and he was forced to live in exile for 19 years.During this time, he wrote such major works as Les Misérables.Becoming an assembly member again following his return to his home country, he was given a state funeral after his death in Paris.However, the latter half of the 19th century, when Hugo was celebrated as a hero of the republicans, (6)was also a time when France adopted a more aggressive posture toward other countries.
Question 9
In regard to the underlined portion (5), from ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that incorrectly describes political events that Hugo (1802-85) encountered during his lifetime.
30
①After Napoleon I was ousted, Louis XVI was restored to the throne, thereby reviving the Bourbon dynasty.
②As a result of the July Revolution, a system of defending the profits of bankers and other major financiers was established.
③Louis-Napoléon was elected in the presidential election held during the Second Republic.
④The common people of Paris, who were resentful of the humiliating terms of the peace agreement with Germany, declared the establishment of the Paris Commune.
Question 10
In regard once more to the underlined portion (5), Balzac was among those who participated in the literary salons held by Hugo.From ①~④ below, choose the most appropriate sentence concerning Balzac's literary tendency.
31
①Symbolism
②Classicism
③Romanticism
④Realism
Question 11
In regard to the underlined portion (6), from ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that correctly describes France's foreign policy in the latter half of the 19th century.
32
①It forced Joseon to embark on a process of opening up during the rule of the Daewongun.
②It came into conflict with Spain about dividing up Africa and caused the Fashoda Incident.
③It concluded a friendship treaty with Japan before the USA and the UK did so.
④It dispatched troops to Mexico, but this ended in failure.
[4]
Agriculture is mankind's most basic form of occupation and the conditions faced by farmers are an indicator that helps us to understand a particular era or society. Read the following texts A-C, which relate to agriculture and farmers, and answer the questions (Questions 1-9) below.
(22 points)
ＡIn the Roman Empire, primarily on the Italian Peninsula, agricultural management of extensive landed estates developed over the course of several centuries, starting a couple of centuries before the beginning of the Christian era, mainly using slaves.Such extensive landed estates were called (1) and they produced crops on a large scale for commercial purposes.Moreover, writings emerged that discussed effective crop cultivation methods and (2)efficient slave usage methods.At the same time, there was an influx to Rome of impoverished peasants who had relinquished their agricultural land.Grain and bread, among other foods, were distributed to urban citizens without property, who had increased in number in this way.In the (3)Roman provinces in the east of the empire, such as Egypt, which was the main source of supply of this grain, the traditional agricultural communes survived, with peasant farmers and tenant farmers engaging in agriculture, so the situation in society there differed from that in the west of the empire.
Question 1
From ①~④ below, choose the correct word that should be inserted into the gap marked (1) in the text.
33
①manufacture
②latifundia
③iqta
④kolkhoz
Question 2
In regard to the underlined portion (2), from ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that incorrectly describes slaves.
34
①The first Muslim dynasty that took Delhi as its capital was called the Slave Dynasty (Mamluk dynasty).
②The leader of the great slave rebellion that occurred in Italy in the first century BC was Spartacus.
③The system of slavery was abolished in Athens when democracy was perfected.
④Black slaves were introduced in Spanish colonies in Central and South America.
Question 3
The region referred to in the underlined portion (3) came under the rule of the Byzantine Empire after the empire split into eastern and western regions.From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that is correct as a description of the Byzantine Empire.
35
①St. Sophia's Cathedral in Constantinople was built at the order of Leo III the Isaurian.
②Constantinople was temporarily conquered by the Sassanid Empire and became its capital.
③One of the characteristics of the Byzantine style was the use of mosaics.
④After the East-West Schism finally occurred, the Byzantine Empire stipulated Greek as its official language.
ＢThe (4)mastery of feudal lords over peasant farmers in Russia and Eastern Europe was restructured and strengthened in the 15th and 16th centuries, and production of grain for export flourished.(5)Ownership of large tracts of land continued for a long time in this region and it lagged behind in terms of the emancipation of the peasant farmers, so the peasant movement demanding emancipation developed into a major force.In the 19th century, emancipation of the peasants took place in this region as well, but their economic situation did not necessarily improve.Land reforms were carried out in Russia after the October Revolution and in (6)Eastern Europe after the Second World War, and new approaches to agriculture were pursued under socialism.Under this system, farmers were required to cooperate and collectivize in various ways.
Question 4
From ①~④ below, choose the sentence in which the word with a wavy line below it is correct in regard to peasant farmers in Central and Eastern Europe, in relation to the underlined portion (4).
36
①In Austria, efforts were made to emancipate peasants under Frederick the Great.
②The emancipation of peasants in Prussia was carried out amid the Thirty Years' War.
③In Poland and Lithuania, which united to form a kingdom in the 14th century, farmers were increasingly bound to the land.
④Gustavus Adolphus, who opposed the Partitions of Poland, declared the emancipation of the peasants.
Question 5
In regard to the underlined portion (5), from ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that incorrectly describes peasant farmers and agriculture in Russia.
37
①In 17th century Russia, the Peasants' Rebellion took place under the leadership of Müntzer.
②After Pugachev's Rebellion, serfdom was reinforced.
③The emancipation of the serfs took place in Russia, which had been defeated in the Crimean War.
④After the revolution of 1905, agricultural reforms were carried out during the reign of Nicholas II.
Question 6
From ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that is correct in regard to the underlined portion (6).
38
①The Polish Corridor was created.
②Albania was made a protectorate of Italy.
③Rijeka (Fiume) in Yugoslavia was annexed by Italy.
④Yugoslavia was expelled from Cominform (the Communist Party Information Bureau).
ＣSoutheast Asia is located in a tropical and subtropical monsoon belt, and rice cultivation has been carried out there since ancient times.Moreover, this region produced spices, so, (7)seeking these, European powers began to enter into trade in this region by force in the early 16th century.However, when major changes in the situation surrounding trade in Asia occurred, such as a slump in the price of spices, farmers began to be forced to cultivate specific commercial crops.(8)Colonial rule, involving the management of land and manpower in order to expand production of commercial crops, gained momentum in the 19th century.Society was transformed substantially, with the focus of agricultural production in Southeast Asia shifting from growing food for subsistence purposes to producing (9)commercial crops for markets around the world.Due to the oppression they suffered in their daily lives, peasant rebellions occurred in various regions, and these foreshadowed the subsequent nationalist movements.
Question 7
In regard to the underlined portion (7), from ①~④ below, choose the one sentence that correctly describes Southeast Asia during the 16th and 17th centuries.
39
①The Netherlands was the first of the countries of Europe to advance into Southeast Asia.
②France was pushed out of the Maluku (Molucca) Islands as a result of the Amboyna massacre.
③The UK occupied Malacca.
④Spain used Manila as its base for trade in Asia.
Question 8
In regard to the underlined portion (8), from ①~④ below, choose the sentence in which the word with a wavy line below it is correct in regard to colonial rule by the Great Powers in Southeast Asia.
40
①Portugal earned enormous profits as a result of its forced cultivation system in Java.
②Thailand was the only country in Southeast Asia to be spared colonial rule and retain its independence.
③The rebellion of the Black Flag Army, which opposed British colonial rule, took place in Vietnam.
④France's Straits Settlements and the realm of the Dutch East Indies were established after the Napoleonic Wars.
Question 9
In regard to the underlined portion (9), from ①~④ below, choose the one option that was not a major commercial crop for export produced in Java.
41
①Coffee
②Rice
③Indigo
④Sugarcane
